page.title: 10INDIAN WAR MEMORIAL
page.content: The Chattri is a memorial to the Indian soldiers who died fighting in the First World War and who were in hospital in Brighton. It is situated on the Downs outside Brighton and can only be approached on foot. You can see the memorial for miles around because it is white and stands out. It has a little garden surrounding it and it is in the shape of a small dome, like a little Indian temple. The garden is unfortunately rather overgrown. On one side of the Chattri the English inscription tells us that the memorial marks the spot where the soldiers' bodies were burned on a traditional funeral pyre. There is an inscription in Hindi on the other side. Poppy wreaths and flowers had recently been placed there by Indian visitors. It is a very peaceful spot to remember men who died far from home
